oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hand-tinted tintype of Lt. Lucien Coatsworth Gause
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1st Lt. Gause served in Co. G, 1st Ark. Inf., CSA and later as a colonel in the 32nd Ark. Inf., CSA. After the war, he became Congressman from Arkansas. His family was from Durhamville, in Lauderdale County, Tennessee. His cheeks were hand-tinted pink.; A gold-tinted pin, possibly a Phi Kappa Sigma fraternity badge from University of Virginia, adorned his uniform coat.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Gause, Lucien Coatsworth, 1836-1880
